result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael NMI Rodriguez-Serrano

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Michael NMI Rodriguez-Serrano
Current: 933 6th Ave #208, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2022)
Prior: 933 6th Ave #215, Antigo, WI 54409

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

9:36 AM Defendant Michael NMI Rodriguez-Serrano in court, in custody.  Attorney John Zich in court for Michael NMI Rodriguez-Serrano.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin.  State is ready to proceed.  Officer Kyle Rustick, City of Antigo Police Dept., duly sworn under oath, testifies. State as court to take judicial notice of 19CF226 & 19CF214. Court takes judicial notice of both files. State rest. State ask Court to bind over and gives statement.  Atty Zich gives argument RE: bind over and request Court to deny.  Court gives ruling and finds probable cause & binds over for filing an information.  Court notes two felony cases. Information filed electronically.  Atty Zich has copy of Information, waives reading, reserve rights & enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty plea to all ct's. Atty Zich filed a bond motion to modify bond. Court reviews motion for bond modification.  Atty Zich heard on bond modification, gives argument. State objects to bond modification & gives argument. Court gives ruling & will amend bond to $1,250.00 cash with same conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety,  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:45 PM Defendant Michael NMI Rodriguez-Serrano appeared by video, in custody, via zoom.  Attorney John Zich in court, via zoom for Michael NMI Rodriguez-Serrano.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Zich has copy of complaint, waives reading, reserve rights and request timely p.h. Atty Zich may appear via zoom for p.h. Bond remains.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Maintain absolute sobriety No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

1:14 PM/Room 203.  Defendant Michael NMI Rodriguez-Serrano appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State heard on bond, recommends $2,500 cash bond with conditions maintain absolute sobriety, no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, and no illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Def. on PO hold. Def. heard on bond. Remarks by the Court. The Court orders $2,500 cash bond. Court notes on record that Def. was belligerant in Court and was escorted out of hearing. Conditions as requested by State.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
